parts:
You are extracting UBX-CFG-NMEA from u-blox PDF manual pages.

**CRITICAL for talker ID fields:**
- `bdsTalkerId` is type CH (single character), NOT CH[2]
- `gpsTalkerId` is type CH (single character), NOT CH[2]

The CH type in UBX represents a single ASCII character (1 byte).
When the manual shows "2 bytes" for a talker ID, it means 2 separate CH fields, not an array.

Return using ubx_message_extraction tool.

bitfield.name: posFilt
bitfield.description: Enable position output for failed or invalid fixes

bitfield.name: mskPosFilt
bitfield.description: Enable position output for invalid fixes

bitfield.name: timeFilt
bitfield.description: Enable time output for invalid times

bitfield.name: dateFilt
bitfield.description: Enable date output for invalid dates

bitfield.name: gpsOnlyFilter
bitfield.description: Restrict output to GPS satellites only

bitfield.name: trackFilt
bitfield.description: Enable COG output even if COG is frozen

fields.name: numSV
fields.description: Maximum number of SVs to report per TalkerId.

fields.name: gnssToFilter
fields.description: Filters out satellites based on their GNSS. If a bitfield is enabled, the corresponding satellites will be not output.

fields.name: svNumbering
fields.description: Configures the display of satellites that do not have an NMEA-defined value.

values.description: Extended - Use proprietary numbering (see Satellite Numbering)

fields.name: mainTalkerId
fields.description: Main Talker ID. 0: Main Talker ID is not overridden, 1: Set main Talker ID to 'GP', 2: Set main Talker ID to 'GL', 3: Set main Talker ID to 'GN', 4: Set main Talker ID to 'GA', 5: Set main Talker ID to 'GB', 6: Set main Talker ID to 'GQ' (available in NMEA 4.11 and later).

values.description: Main Talker ID is not overridden
Set main Talker ID to 'GQ' (available in NMEA 4.11 and later)

fields.name: gsvTalkerId
fields.description: GSV Talker ID. 0: Use GNSS-specific Talker ID (as defined by NMEA), 1: Use the main Talker ID.

values.description: Use GNSS-specific Talker ID (as defined by NMEA)
